summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for July 15, 2019, documenting routine operations, staffing, and inmate counts. It is significant as it was created the month before Jeffrey Epstein's death while he was incarcerated at this facility, providing a snapshot of its operational status.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, including shift reports, staff shortages, and inmate population counts.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The report is dated July 16, 2019, documenting activity from July 15, 2019, approximately one month before Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility on August 10, 2019.
The report notes a staff shortage on the Day Watch Shift in the Housing Unit.
The total inmate population at the beginning of the Morning Watch shift on July 15, 2019, was 798.
The report lists inmates under various statuses, including 'Psych Obs.' (Psychological Observation) with an inmate companion and at a 'Local Hospice' with USMS (U.S. Marshals Service) guards.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case file evidence.
